first_reading.text:
[[Pr 31,10]]When one finds a worthy wife, her value is far beyond pearls.
[[Pr 31,11]]Her husband, entrusting his heart to her, has an unfailing prize.
[[Pr 31,12]]She brings him good, and not evil, all the days of her life.
[[Pr 31,13]]She obtains wool and flax and makes cloth with skillful hands.
[[Pr 31,19]]She puts her hands to the distaff, and her fingers ply the spindle.
[[Pr 31,20]]She reaches out her hands to the poor, and extends her arms to the needy.
[[Pr 31,30]]Charm is deceptive and beauty fleeting; the woman who fears the LORD is to be praised.
[[Pr 31,31]]Give her a reward of her labors, and let her works praise her at the city gates.
first_reading.title: Book of Proverbs

psalm.text:
[[Ps 128,1]]Blessed are you who fear the LORD, 
who walk in his ways!
[[Ps 128,2]]For you shall eat the fruit of your handiwork; 
blessed shall you be, and favored.

[[Ps 128,3]]Your wife shall be like a fruitful vine 
in the recesses of your home; 
Your children like olive plants 
around your table.

[[Ps 128,4]]Behold, thus is the man blessed 
who fears the LORD.
[[Ps 128,5]]The LORD bless you from Zion: 
may you see the prosperity of Jerusalem 
all the days of your life.
psalm.title: Psalms

second_reading.text:
[[1_Th 5,1]]Concerning times and seasons, brothers and sisters, you have no need for anything to be written to you.
[[1_Th 5,2]]For you yourselves know very well that the day of the Lord will come like a thief at night.
[[1_Th 5,3]]When people are saying, "Peace and security," then sudden disaster comes upon them, like labor pains upon a pregnant woman,and they will not escape.
[[1_Th 5,4]]But you, brothers, are not in darkness, for that day to overtake you like a thief.
[[1_Th 5,5]]For all of you are children of the light and children of the day. We are not of the night or of darkness.
[[1_Th 5,6]]Therefore, let us not sleep as the rest do, but let us stay alert and sober.
second_reading.title: First Letter to the Thessalonians

gospel.text:
[[Mt 25,14]]Jesus told his disciples this parable: “A man going on a journey called in his servants and entrusted his possessions to them.
[[Mt 25,15]]To one he gave five talents; to another, two; to a third, one– to each according to his ability. Then he went away. Immediately
[[Mt 25,16]]the one who received five talents went and traded with them, and made another five.
[[Mt 25,17]]Likewise, the one who received two made another two.
[[Mt 25,18]]But the man who received one went off and dug a hole in the ground and buried his master's money.
[[Mt 25,19]]After a long time the master of those servants came back and settled accounts with them.
[[Mt 25,20]]The one who had received five talents came forward bringing the additional five. He said, 'Master, you gave me five talents. See, I have made five more.'
[[Mt 25,21]]His master said to him, 'Well done, my good and faithful servant. Since you were faithful in small matters, I will give you great responsibilities. Come, share your master's joy.'
[[Mt 25,22]](Then) the one who had received two talents also came forward and said, 'Master, you gave me two talents. See, I have made two more.'
[[Mt 25,23]]His master said to him, 'Well done, my good and faithful servant. Since you were faithful in small matters, I will give you great responsibilities. Come, share your master's joy.'
[[Mt 25,24]]Then the one who had received the one talent came forward and said, 'Master, I knew you were a demanding person, harvesting where you did not plant and gathering where you did not scatter;
[[Mt 25,25]]so out of fear I went off and buried your talent in the ground. Here it is back.'
[[Mt 25,26]]His master said to him in reply, 'You wicked, lazy servant! So you knew that I harvest where I did not plant and gather where I did not scatter?
[[Mt 25,27]]Should you not then have put my money in the bank so that I could have got it back with interest on my return?
[[Mt 25,28]]Now then! Take the talent from him and give it to the one with ten.
[[Mt 25,29]]For to everyone who has, more will be given and he will grow rich; but from the one who has not, even what he has will be taken away.
[[Mt 25,30]]And throw this useless servant into the darkness outside, where there will be wailing and grinding of teeth.'”
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
